meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp movement or jerk.
meanings.sent1: The car hit a bump and gave a jol.
meanings.sent2: I felt a jol when the elevator stopped abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jol made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His words gave a mental jol to her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The jol of the earthquake was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To move or shake with sudden jerks.
meanings.sent1: She tried to jol the stubborn door open.
meanings.sent2: The train started to jol as it picked up speed.
meanings.sent3: He had to jol the ketchup bottle to get it out.
meanings.sent4: The storm continued to jol the trees all night.
meanings.sent5: The old engine began to jol and sputter.

meanings.sent1: We had a jol at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The town square was filled with music and jol.
meanings.sent3: The jol lasted until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent4: The jol of the New Year's Eve fireworks lit up the sky.
meanings.sent5: The jol of the festival brought smiles to everyone's faces.
